intro: Poecilochroma brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved starling plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and aromatic leaves. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, and its short, broad leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
